intro: Machaeranthera leptophylla, commonly known as the slenderleaf blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the central and southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. It produces striking yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its slender leaves and compact stature make it a distinctive feature in its native ecosystem.
